posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Hi all, we were attempting to reimage the robot but encountered an error related to the robot imaging tool. We used Balena etcher to flash the SD card into the RoboRIO and reached that point. Initially, we thought the SD card might be corrupted due to previous errors, but using Rufus for flashing didn't work either. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: According to the docs, the roboRIO Imaging Tool is not supported. Instead, imaging the SD card is recommended.

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, we imaged the SD card and followed the same steps on the documents and videos.

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: Are you encountering this error while trying to set the team number? If so, could you send an image of the Imaging Tool with the parameters before you hit apply (and the error popup covers all the info in the Imaging tool)?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: SD imaging error since nothing shows up for current image and firmware version but we followed all steps

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked: Since the team number can also be set using the Team Number Setter, you can try it too. If that fails, it might be an SD card image issue.

link_counts.title: roboRIO Team Number Setter — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked:
Thanks! The number setting does not seem to be the issue. However, when deploying the code, we consistently encounter a "Build Failed" error (mDNS error on console) and the "Robot" indicator on the driver station never turns green.  

Here is the error log:

- Discovering target roboio
  - Admin @ roborio-10152-[FRC<template class="tooltiptext" data-text="FIRST Robotics Competition">].lan: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException
  - Admin @ roborio-10152-[FRC<template class="tooltiptext" data-text="FIRST Robotics Competition">].local: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException
  - Admin @ 10.101.52.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: RuntimeException
  - Admin @ 172.22.11.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException
  - Admin @ null: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException
  - Admin @ roborio-10152-[FRC<template class="tooltiptext" data-text="FIRST Robotics Competition">].frc-field.local: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException
  - Admin @ roborio-10152-[FRC<template class="tooltiptext" data-text="FIRST Robotics Competition">]: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException
  - Run with --info for more details

![Screenshot 2025-02-21 144516](https:// chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/9/3/93adb3d99b026aee4c7db23f2e6878ba07baf453.png)

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: The number setting is an issue here. You need to have the team number set correctly so you can see the robot with the other tooling. As shown in the screenshot, it isn't set yet. The name of the roborio is the default one before it’s set.

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: A screenshot titled "Screenshot 2025-02-24 083757" showing the robot connecting to roboRIO was taken. A screenshot titled "Screenshot 2025-02-24 083656" showing the robot attempting to connect to roboRIO was also taken.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Have you tried re-imaging? We had the exact same behaviour. Re-imaging solved it. Also why does it say Team # USB on your DS Driver Station? Have you set the team number for DS Driver Station?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, we've re-imaged the roborio several times. We're currently operating on the USB stage instead of connecting through radio.

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: Is your team number set in the DS setting?

posts.name: Ryan
posts.cooked: Yes, it's currently set to our team number in the settings tab.

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked: Hi. Did you solve the problem? We’re facing the same issue and would appreciate any update. Edit: Nevermind, we found the solution. There must be a radio.
